conbody.p: Thank you for your interest in the , , which provides a simple method for generating high-quality PDFs from DITA on Windows system using , where formatting is controlled via a GUI template design tool, .
This Getting Started guide provides the information you need to get up and running publishing your DITA content, fast.

The plugin maps DITA to the MiramoXML model, then applies template-controlled formatting using . It is designed to be easily integrated with your chosen XML authoring tool or content management system, or run with the standalone DITA-OT using a simple command line interface described in .

The plugin is designed to cover standard formatting requirements for DITA document content out of the box, using a combination of and but for bespoke requirements it may be customized to suit your needs - for information see .
